questions.question: The god Quetzalcoatl is recognized in
The ancestral spirits of the Pueblo peoples are known as
The cycle of birth, death and rebirth. You pay for good or bad deeds based on your behavior.
Weekly day of rest and prayer. This is on Saturday for the Jews.
The principles (Buddhism) that rule life and promise an end to suffering.
A special leader sent by God in order to guide people and set up God's rule.
The two civilizations of India where Hinduism originated
In Hinduism and Buddhism, the end result of all of a person's good and bad acts, which determines his or her rebirth.
The sacred text of the religion of Islam.
A journey to a place considered sacred for religious purposes.

questions.answer: C: An extra month, every 30 months
questions.optionA: A: An extra day, every third week
questions.optionB: B: An extra minute, every 14 hours
questions.optionC: C: An extra month, every 30 months
questions.optionD: D: An extra week, every quarter

questions.answer: D: The first day of Lent

questions.question: What differentiates "Eucharist", "Lord's Supper" and "Holy Communion"?
questions.answer: A: Nothing - all the same sacrament
questions.optionA: A: Nothing - all the same sacrament
questions.optionB: B: Given at different times of day
questions.optionC: C: Given by different levels of priest
questions.optionD: D: Given at different times of year

questions.question: A follower of Islam is called a _____________________.

The founder of Buddhism is ______________________

questions.answer: C: The Vedas, Maharbharata, and the Upanishads
questions.optionA: A: The Torah and the Hebrew Bible
questions.optionB: B: The Qu'ran and the teachings Abraham
questions.optionC: C: The Vedas, Maharbharata, and the Upanishads

questions.answer: D: Become a missionary in a foreign land

questions.optionC: C: Middle East or Southwest Asia

questions.answer: A: With respect, dignity and equality
